tif

Class IFDHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • tif.IFDHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ImageHandler

    public class IFDHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements ImageHandler
    This IFDHandler parses TIFF-based files by reading and interpreting Image File Directories (IFDs) within the file's binary structure.

    It supports standard TIFF 6.0 parsing, including IFD0, EXIF, GPS, and INTEROP directories, traversed recursively via tag-defined pointers.

    Note: BigTIFF (version 43) is detected but not supported.

    Since:
    5 September 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    TIFF 6.0 Specification (Adobe) for in-depth technical information

    • Method Detail

      • isBigTiffVersion

        public boolean isBigTiffVersion()
        Indicates whether the parsed file is a BigTIFF variant (version 43).
        Returns:
        boolean true if the TIFF version is BigTIFF, otherwise false

        Specified by:

      • parseMetadata

        public boolean parseMetadata()
        Parses the image data stream and attempts to extract metadata directories.

        After invoking this method, use getDirectories() to retrieve the list of IFD (Image File Directory) structures that were successfully parsed.

        Specified by:
        parseMetadata in interface ImageHandler
        Returns:
        true if at least one metadata directory was successfully extracted, otherwise false

      • getDirectories

        public java.util.Optional<java.util.List<DirectoryIFD>> getDirectories()
        Returns the list of IFD directories that were successfully parsed.

        If no directories were found, this method returns Optional.empty(). Otherwise, it returns an Optional containing a copy of the parsed IFD directory list.

        Returns:
        an Optional containing at least one DirectoryIFD, or Optional.empty() if no directories were parsed

      • readTifHeader

        private long readTifHeader()
        Reads the TIFF header to determine the byte order, version (Standard or BigTIFF), and the offset to the first Image File Directory (IFD0). The first two bytes indicate the byte order ("II" for little-endian or "MM" for big-endian). The next two bytes contain the TIFF version number (42 for standard TIFF, 43 for BigTIFF). Finally, the last four bytes of the 8-byte header specify the offset to the first IFD.
        Returns:
        the offset to the first IFD0 directory, otherwise zero if the header is invalid

      • navigateImageFileDirectory

        private void navigateImageFileDirectory(DirectoryIdentifier dirType,
                                        long startOffset)
        Recursively traverses the specified Image File Directory and its linked sub-directories. An IFD is a sequence of 12-byte entries, each containing a tag ID, a field type, a count of values, and a 4-byte value or offset. This method iterates through these entries, reads the corresponding data, and if an entry points to another IFD (like EXIF, GPS, or Interop), it recursively calls itself to parse that sub-directory.
        Parameters:
        dirType - the directory type being processed
        startOffset - the file offset (from header base) where the IFD begins
